title: [K-12] Fuel Cell Electrode Design Optimization: A Multiphysics Modeling Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental principles of fuel cells, basics of differential equations, foundational concepts of optimization theory
context.additional_context: Combining real-time online discussions with offline lab sessions, learners access simulation tools via personal devices

learning_goals: Learners can quantitatively analyze the performance-cost trade-off relationship of fuel cell electrodes through multiphysics modeling
Learners can design procedures to solve multiobjective optimization problems using the NSGA-II algorithm
Learners can explain methods to approximate complex nonlinear systems by building deep learning-based surrogate models
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
